clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Effectiveness of Vibrotactile Sensory Stimulation in Fibromyalgia Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effectiveness of low-intensity and prolonged vibrotactile sensory stimulation on symptom relieve in fibromyalgia patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The trial will last up to 8 weeks for each subject and includes:
Three weeks treatment 1 (sham or actual) Two week washout Three weeks treatment 2 (sham or actual) Vibrotactile sensory stimulation will consist on whole-body stimulation with mechanical stimuli of pallesthetic type at high rate, low intensity and long daily duration.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: a sham device identical to the active device

primary_outcome.description: Change on fibromyalgia key symptoms rated using 101-point verbal rating scale (combining pain, fatigue and subjective cognitive problems).

secondary_outcome.description: Change on fibromyalgia secondary symptoms (including sleep disturbance, anxiety, mood, activity limitation, treatment reduction and general health rating).

intervention.description: Vibrotactile sensory stimulation will consist on whole-body stimulation with mechanical stimuli of pallesthetic type at high rate (20-90 Hz), low intensity and long daily duration (3h).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of fibromyalgia according to the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) (Arthritis Rheum, 1990;33:160-172)
- Clinical symptoms are not a consequence of other medical disorder (although the presence of other disorders is not an exclusion criterion)
- Diagnoses established by an expert on fibromyalgia.
- Stable treatment of chronic use.
- Subject demonstrates an understanding of the study and a willingness to participate as evidenced by voluntary written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Generalized inflammatory articular or rheumatic disease.
- Heavily exercise for 12 hours prior to fMRI assessment
- Severe, non-stable medical, endocrinological or neurological disorder.
- Psychotic disorder or drug abuse.
